headline.print_headline: Africa; Libya: Islamic State Attacks Oil Port
headline.main: Libya: Islamic State Attacks Oil Port

snippet: Islamic State militants attempted to capture an oil port along Libya’s coast, in fighting that left at least seven people dead and set fire to a storage tank of crude oil....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Islamic State militants launch another attack in Libya to capture the Sidra oil port in an attempt to expand its territory; fighting results in seven fatalities and sets fire to storage tank of crude oil.
lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants attempted to capture an oil port along Libya’s coast, in fighting that left at least seven people dead and set fire to a storage tank of crude oil.

headline.print_headline: Boko Haram on Attack, Proving ISIS Is Resilient
headline.main: Boko Haram Attacks Signal Resilience of ISIS and Its Branches

snippet: Renewed violence by a Boko Haram faction in Nigeria and Niger restores a deadly urgency to the conflict just as it seemed the militants were losing traction....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Fresh wave of Boko Haram attacks in Nigeria and neighboring Niger, despite reports of militant group's decline, suggest shift in strategy influenced by its affiliation with Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: Renewed violence by a Boko Haram faction in Nigeria and Niger restores a deadly urgency to the conflict just as it seemed the militants were losing traction.

byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Diffa, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Ubale Musa and Chris Stein contributed reporting from Abuja, Nigeria.
byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and ERIC SCHMITT

headline.print_headline: Arsonists in Belgium Hit Country’s Main Crime Lab
headline.main: Arson Attack Damages Crime Lab in Brussels

snippet: No one was wounded, but the destruction was described as severe, and evidence crucial to terrorism investigations may have been damaged....
abstract: Arsonists behind attack on Belgium's National Institute of Forensics and Criminology remain at large while investigators search for possible suspects in case that may be ruled as terrorist act.
lead_paragraph: No one was wounded, but the destruction was described as severe, and evidence crucial to terrorism investigations may have been damaged.

headline.print_headline: Attack at University in Kabul Shatters a Sense of Freedom
headline.main: Attack at University in Kabul Shatters a Sense of Freedom

snippet: Men with rifles and grenades put the American University of Afghanistan, an oasis from violence, through an ordeal that lasted nearly 10 hours and claimed 13 lives....
abstract: Attack on American University of Afghanistan has shattered sense of freedom and security that prevailed on campus, place that had been free of unpredictable violence in rest of Kabul; attack is undoubtedly blow to those Afghans who sought to pursue their educations at home rather than leave for abroad.
lead_paragraph: Men with rifles and grenades put the American University of Afghanistan, an oasis from violence, through an ordeal that lasted nearly 10 hours and claimed 13 lives.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL, MOHAMAD FAHIM ABED and ZAHRA NADER

headline.main: Saudis and Extremism: ‘Both the Arsonists and the Firefighters’

snippet: Critics see Saudi Arabia’s export of a rigid strain of Islam as contributing to terrorism, but the kingdom’s influence depends greatly on local conditions....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Government officials from around world as well as experts on Islam say Saudi Arabia has played dual role with respect to rise of Islamic terrorism, helping spread fundamentalist strain called Wahhabism even as it has been involved in counterterrorism; debate about Saudi influence on Islam has gained new relevance in light of Islamic State group carrying out attacks with increasing frequency against West.
lead_paragraph: Critics see Saudi Arabia’s export of a rigid strain of Islam as contributing to terrorism, but the kingdom’s influence depends greatly on local conditions.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

headline.print_headline: Even Young Are Suspect in War on Boko Haram
headline.main: Nigeria Is Freeing Children From Boko Haram, Then Locking Them Up

snippet: Civilians, and even infants, are ending up in military detention centers as Nigeria holds people it suspects of being sympathizers of the Islamist extremist group....
abstract: Civilians, and even infants, are ending up in military detention centers as Nigeria holds people it suspects of being Boko Haram sympathizers; Boko Haram has managed to turn many captives into suicide bombers, even children as young as eight years old.
lead_paragraph: Civilians, and even infants, are ending up in military detention centers as Nigeria holds people it suspects of being sympathizers of the Islamist extremist group.

headline.main: German Who Plotted to Bomb U.S. Targets in Europe Gets Out of Prison Early

snippet: Fritz Gelowicz, who had trained with an offshoot of Al Qaeda in Pakistan, received a 12-year sentence in 2010....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Fritz Gelowicz, who had trained with an offshoot of Al Qaeda in Pakistan, received a 12-year sentence in 2010.

headline.print_headline: Trump Backs Guantánamo for Trials of Americans
headline.main: Donald Trump ‘Fine’ With Prosecuting U.S. Citizens at Guantánamo

snippet: If Mr. Trump were elected and followed through on his impulse, the move would face legal, political and practical obstacles, specialists said....
abstract: Donald Trump, in response to interviewer's question, says he is fine with idea of prosecuting American citizens who are accused of terrorism charges before military commission at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base in Cuba; prosecution of American citizens by military tribunals system is barred under Military Commission Act.
lead_paragraph: If Mr. Trump were elected and followed through on his impulse, the move would face legal, political and practical obstacles, specialists said.

headline.main: Boko Haram Leader Speaks on YouTube, Deepening Signs of Split

snippet: The audio recording of the leader, Abubakar Shekau, came hours after an Islamic State publication suggested that another militant had taken control of Boko Haram....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Security experts say new audio recording uploaded to YouTube by Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau contains apparent reference to split within Nigerian Islamist militant group; suggest clip is response to Islamic State publication asserting that group's spokesman Abu Musab al-Barnawi is now its leader.
lead_paragraph: The audio recording of the leader, Abubakar Shekau, came hours after an Islamic State publication suggested that another militant had taken control of Boko Haram.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

headline.print_headline: Uncovering the Lives Lost to Terrorist Attacks
headline.main: 2 Weeks, 8 Terror Attacks, 247 Victims: How We Learned Their Stories

snippet: At first we set out to cover the month of March. But the attacks kept coming, so we scaled back, for fear of being overwhelmed....
abstract: Jodi Rudoren describes arduous process New York Times reporters used in attempt to gather information about victims of terrorist attacks around globe during particularly bloody two-week period in March.
lead_paragraph: At first we set out to cover the month of March. But the attacks kept coming, so we scaled back, for fear of being overwhelmed.
